ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] What happens when you go LD...
ygData.msgSnippet: Gah!  I m a bard!  I managed to CR even without the invis...hehe.  :)  It was a big tunnel, and empty. The only thing I can figure, is the last command the
ygData.messageBody:
Gah! I'm a bard! I managed to CR even without the invis...hehe. :) It
was a big tunnel, and empty.

The only thing I can figure, is the last command the server received from
me, was a forward movement, so that when I went LD, it continued to run
forward. Naturally, this would have taken my body straight through the most
populated area of the giant fort, no doubt I'd die quickly.

Atonal

-----Original Message-----
From: Daniel Sniderman [mailto:fuzzbone@...]
Sent: Tuesday, May 08, 2001 5:57 PM
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] What happens when you go LD...


I've had deaths with corpses in the wrong spot - especially after linkdeath
(could be crazy AI when you're linkdead) or whatever. Assuming they don't
think you're not being truthful I'd expect a guide would summon your corpse
out if you have problems with the CR

Slyde

-----Original Message-----
From: Christopher Sanders [mailto:christopher.sanders@...]
Sent: Tuesday, May 08, 2001 3:56 PM
To: Eqbards (E-mail)
Subject: [eqbards] What happens when you go LD...


...fighting giants in FM the other night, I dinged 32. About 3 or 4 kills
later, I go linkdead. I'm in a full group, there is another full group just
down the wall from us. I figure I'm pretty safe, right?

I get back on after my cable modem stops having fits, and I'm at my bind
point, back to 31. I only grab a drum out of the stash. I won't need
invis, right? The giant fort is well camped, and my corpse will be just
inside, right?

Hehe...wrong! I get back to the spot, and it's nowhere in sight. I pulse
in a locate, and of course, it points me deep into the fort. I never
noticed the cave in the back. In I go. Oh, there it is, about halfway
down. How the heck did I get there! When I went LD, I was standing by the
wall whacking a giant!

Oh well.
